intro: Ficus tanypoda, commonly known as the small-leaf fig, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically small and ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences called syconia. Ficus tanypoda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to indoor conditions. It requires bright, indirect light and consistent moisture to thrive.
